content.question:
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in means will be conducted to investigate whether the average amount of money spent per customer at Department Store M is different from that at Department Store V. From a random sample of 35 customers at Store M, the average amount spent was $300 with standard deviation $40. From a random sample of 40 customers at Store V, the average amount spent was $290 with standard deviation $35.
Assuming a null hypothesis of no difference in population means, which of the following is the test statistic for the appropriate test to investigate whether there is a difference in population means (Department Store M minus Department Store V) ?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals the square root of the fraction with numerator 300 minus 290, and denominator the fraction with numerator 35 squared and denominator 40, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 40 squared and denominator 35, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>290</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 300 minus 290, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 40 squared, plus 35 squared, and denominator 35 plus 40, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>290</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 300 minus 290, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 40 plus 35, and denominator 35 plus 40, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>290</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>40</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>35</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 300 minus 290, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 40 squared and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 35 squared and denominator 40, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>290</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 300 minus 290, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 40 and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 35 and denominator 40, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>290</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 300 minus 290, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 40 squared and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 35 squared and denominator 40, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>290</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
